com.gwidgets.api.leaflet.options

Class MapOptions

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.gwidgets.api.leaflet.options.MapOptions

  • @JsType(isNative=true,
        namespace="<global>",
        name="Object")
public class MapOptions
extends java.lang.Object
    The map options used when creating a Map
    Author:
    Zakaria Amine

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.Boolean getAttributionControl()
      Gets Whether the attribution control is added to the map by default.
      java.lang.Boolean getBounceAtZoomLimits()
      Gets whether the map zooms beyond min/max zoom and then bounce back when pinch-zooming.
      java.lang.Boolean getBoxZoom()
      Gets Whether the map can be zoomed to a rectangular area specified by dragging the mouse while pressing shift.
      LatLng getCenter()
      Gets the Initial geographical center of the map.
      java.lang.Boolean getClosePopupOnClick()
      Gets whether the popups close when user clicks the map.
      java.lang.Boolean getDoubleClickZoom()
      Gets Whether the map can be zoomed in by double clicking on it and zoomed out by double clicking while holding shift.
      java.lang.Boolean getDragging()
      Gets Whether the map be draggable with mouse/touch or not.
      java.lang.Boolean getFadeAnimation()
      Gets Whether the tile fade animation is enabled.
      java.lang.Boolean getInertia()
      Gets whether the panning of the map will have an inertia effect where the map builds momentum while dragging and continues moving in the same direction for some time.
      double getInertiaDeceleration()
      Gets the rate with which the inertial movement slows down, in pixels/second2.
      double getInertiaMaxSpeed()
      Gets the Max speed of the inertial movement, in pixels/second.
      java.lang.Boolean getKeyboard()
      Gets whether the map id focusable and allows users to navigate the map with keyboard arrows and +/- keys.

      Gets Amount of pixels to pan when pressing an arrow key.

      Gets the Layers that will be added to the map initially.
      java.lang.Boolean getMarkerZoomAnimation()
      Gets Whether markers animate their zoom with the zoom animation, if disabled they will disappear for the length of the animation.

      Gets the bounds that restricts the view if the option is set

      Gets Whether the map can be zoomed by using the mouse wheel.

      Gets mobile hacks for supporting instant taps (fixing 200ms click delay on iOS/Android) and touch holds (fired as contextmenu events).
      double getTapTolerance()
      Gets The max number of pixels a user can shift his finger during touch for it to be considered a valid tap.

      With this option enabled, the map tracks when you pan to another "copy" of the world and seamlessly jumps to the original one so that all overlays like markers and vector layers are still visible.

        @JsOverlay
public final double getMinZoom()
        Gets Minimum zoom level of the map. Overrides any minZoom set on map layers.
        default 0
        Returns:
        the min zoom

        @JsOverlay
public final double getMaxZoom()
        Gets Maximum zoom level of the map. This overrides any maxZoom set on map layers.
        default 0
        Returns:
        the max zoom

      • getDragging

        @JsOverlay
public final java.lang.Boolean getDragging()
        Gets Whether the map be draggable with mouse/touch or not.
        default true
        Returns:
        the dragging

      • getTouchZoom

        @JsOverlay
public final java.lang.Boolean getTouchZoom()
        Gets Whether the map can be zoomed by touch-dragging with two fingers.
        default true
        Returns:
        the touch zoom

      • getScrollWheelZoom

        @JsOverlay
public final java.lang.Boolean getScrollWheelZoom()
        Gets Whether the map can be zoomed by using the mouse wheel. If passed 'center', it will zoom to the center of the view regardless of where the mouse was.
        default true
        Returns:
        the scroll wheel zoom

      • getDoubleClickZoom

        @JsOverlay
public final java.lang.Boolean getDoubleClickZoom()
        Gets Whether the map can be zoomed in by double clicking on it and zoomed out by double clicking while holding shift. If passed 'center', double-click zoom will zoom to the center of the view regardless of where the mouse was.
        default true
        Returns:
        the double click zoom

      • getBoxZoom

        @JsOverlay
public final java.lang.Boolean getBoxZoom()
        Gets Whether the map can be zoomed to a rectangular area specified by dragging the mouse while pressing shift.
        default true
        Returns:
        the box zoom

      • getTap

        @JsOverlay
public final java.lang.Boolean getTap()
        Gets mobile hacks for supporting instant taps (fixing 200ms click delay on iOS/Android) and touch holds (fired as contextmenu events).
        default true
        Returns:
        the tap

      • getTapTolerance

        @JsOverlay
public final double getTapTolerance()
        Gets The max number of pixels a user can shift his finger during touch for it to be considered a valid tap.
        default 15
        Returns:
        the tap tolerance

      • getTrackResize

        @JsOverlay
public final java.lang.Boolean getTrackResize()
        Gets Whether the map automatically handles browser window resize to update itself.
        default true
        Returns:
        the track resize

      • getWorldCopyJump

        @JsOverlay
public final java.lang.Boolean getWorldCopyJump()
        With this option enabled, the map tracks when you pan to another "copy" of the world and seamlessly jumps to the original one so that all overlays like markers and vector layers are still visible.
        default false
        Returns:
        the world copy jump

      • getClosePopupOnClick

        @JsOverlay
public final java.lang.Boolean getClosePopupOnClick()
        Gets whether the popups close when user clicks the map.
        default true
        Returns:
        the close popup on click

      • getBounceAtZoomLimits

        @JsOverlay
public final java.lang.Boolean getBounceAtZoomLimits()
        Gets whether the map zooms beyond min/max zoom and then bounce back when pinch-zooming.
        default true
        Returns:
        the close popup on click

      • getKeyboard

        @JsOverlay
public final java.lang.Boolean getKeyboard()
        Gets whether the map id focusable and allows users to navigate the map with keyboard arrows and +/- keys.
        default true
        Returns:
        the keyboard

      • getKeyboardPanOffset

        @JsOverlay
public final double getKeyboardPanOffset()
        Gets Amount of pixels to pan when pressing an arrow key.
        default 80
        Returns:
        the keyboard pan offset

      • getInertia

        @JsOverlay
public final java.lang.Boolean getInertia()
        Gets whether the panning of the map will have an inertia effect where the map builds momentum while dragging and continues moving in the same direction for some time. Feels especially nice on touch devices.
        default true
        Returns:
        the inertia

      • getInertiaDeceleration

        @JsOverlay
public final double getInertiaDeceleration()
        Gets the rate with which the inertial movement slows down, in pixels/second2.
        default 3000
        Returns:
        the inertia deceleration

      • getInertiaMaxSpeed

        @JsOverlay
public final double getInertiaMaxSpeed()
        Gets the Max speed of the inertial movement, in pixels/second.
        default 1500
        Returns:
        the inertia max speed

      • getZoomControl

        @JsOverlay
public final java.lang.Boolean getZoomControl()
        Gets Whether the zoom control is added to the map by default.
        default true
        Returns:
        the zoom control

      • getAttributionControl

        @JsOverlay
public final java.lang.Boolean getAttributionControl()
        Gets Whether the attribution control is added to the map by default.
        default true
        Returns:
        the attribution control

      • getFadeAnimation

        @JsOverlay
public final java.lang.Boolean getFadeAnimation()
        Gets Whether the tile fade animation is enabled. By default it's enabled in all browsers that support CSS3 Transitions except Android.
        default true
        Returns:
        the fade animation

      • getZoomAnimation

        @JsOverlay
public final java.lang.Boolean getZoomAnimation()
        Gets Whether the tile zoom animation is enabled. By default it's enabled in all browsers that support CSS3 Transitions except Android.
        default true
        Returns:
        the zoom animation

      • getZoomAnimationThreshold

        @JsOverlay
public final double getZoomAnimationThreshold()
        Gets the value that will disable zoom animation if exceeded
        default 4
        Returns:
        the zoom animation threshold

      • getMarkerZoomAnimation

        @JsOverlay
public final java.lang.Boolean getMarkerZoomAnimation()
        Gets Whether markers animate their zoom with the zoom animation, if disabled they will disappear for the length of the animation. By default it's enabled in all browsers that support CSS3 Transitions except Android.
        default true
        Returns:
        the marker zoom animation
